intro: Layia nutans, commonly known as the nodding layia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its flowers are small and yellow, with the petals curving inward, giving it a nodding appearance. Layia nutans is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions and is often found in coastal areas.
